definitions: physical structure of a human or animal including bones, flesh, and organs
main or central part of something, excluding accessories or appendages
organized group of people with a common purpose or function
dead human or animal physical remains
examples: Her body ached from the intense workout yesterday
The doctor examined his body for signs of injury
The body of the car needs extensive repair work
The essay's body contained three main arguments
The student body voted overwhelmingly for the new policy
A body of experts reviewed the research findings
Police discovered the body in the abandoned warehouse
The body was prepared for the funeral service

definitions: person who develops muscles through weightlifting and exercises for competitive or aesthetic purposes
examples: The bodybuilder trained six days a week for competitions
Professional bodybuilders follow strict diet and exercise regimens

definitions: sport and practice of developing muscular physique through exercise and nutrition
examples: Bodybuilding requires dedication to both training and diet
She took up bodybuilding to improve her strength and physique

definitions: person employed to protect someone from physical harm or unwanted attention
examples: The celebrity's bodyguard escorted her through the crowd
He hired a bodyguard after receiving threatening letters

definitions: exterior metal or plastic shell and panels of a vehicle
therapeutic manipulation of body tissues for healing or relaxation
examples: The car's bodywork showed signs of rust and damage
They specialize in custom bodywork for classic automobiles
The spa offers various types of bodywork including deep tissue massage
Regular bodywork helps athletes recover from intense training

definitions: wet muddy ground with acidic water and peat soil
informal British term for toilet or bathroom
examples: The hikers carefully crossed the bog using wooden planks
Rare plants thrive in the acidic conditions of the bog
He went to the bog during the intermission
The pub's bog was surprisingly clean and modern

definitions: golf score of one stroke over par for a hole
piece of dried nasal mucus removed from the nose
unidentified or enemy aircraft in military terminology
examples: He scored a bogey on the difficult par-four hole
After three bogeys, her lead in the tournament disappeared
The child picked a bogey from his nose discreetly
She wiped the bogey away with a tissue
Radar detected two bogeys approaching from the east
The fighter pilots were scrambled to intercept the bogey

definitions: wheeled truck or framework under a locomotive or railway car
examples: The train's bogie needed replacement after years of service
Each bogie supports the weight of the railway carriage

definitions: person with artistic or unconventional lifestyle rejecting conventional values
native or inhabitant of Bohemia region in Czech Republic
examples: The bohemian artist lived in a colorful studio apartment
Greenwich Village attracted bohemians from across the country
His grandmother was a Bohemian who emigrated in 1920
Traditional Bohemian cuisine features hearty meat dishes

definitions: painful infected swelling on skin containing pus caused by bacterial infection
examples: The doctor lanced the boil to drain the infection
A painful boil developed on his neck

definitions: sealed vessel for heating water or generating steam for power or heat
large pot or vessel used for boiling or cooking
examples: The building's boiler provides heat to all apartments
The old boiler needs replacing before winter arrives
She used a double boiler to melt the chocolate
The seafood boiler held twenty pounds of crawfish

definitions: process or state when liquid reaches temperature causing rapid vaporization
examples: The boiling of water occurs at one hundred degrees Celsius
Vigorous boiling helps cook pasta evenly

definitions: weighted rope or cord weapon thrown to entangle legs of animals or people
examples: The gaucho skillfully threw the bola to catch the runaway horse
Ancient hunters used bolas to capture prey

definitions: heavy thick typeface used for emphasis in printed or digital text
examples: The heading was printed in bold to draw attention
She highlighted important terms using bold formatting

definitions: thick heavy printing type used to give emphasis or prominence to text
examples: Key terms appeared in boldface throughout the textbook
The editor requested boldface for all chapter headings

definitions: Spanish dance in triple time with castanets and distinctive rhythm
short open jacket ending above the waist often worn by women
examples: The dancers performed a passionate bolero at the festival
Ravel's Bolero remains one of classical music's most recognizable pieces
She wore a velvet bolero over her evening dress
The bolero jacket complemented her formal outfit perfectly

definitions: rounded seed capsule of cotton or flax plants containing fibers and seeds
examples: Cotton bolls burst open when ready for harvest
Each boll contains about thirty cotton seeds

definitions: necktie consisting of cord with ornamental clasp or slide
large single-edged knife used in Philippines as tool or weapon
examples: He wore a turquoise bolo tie with his western outfit
The silver bolo tie featured intricate Native American designs
The farmer used a bolo to clear thick vegetation
Traditional Filipino warriors carried bolos into battle

definitions: seasoned smoked sausage made from various meats typically served sliced
examples: She made bologna sandwiches for the children's lunch
The deli sliced fresh bologna for their customers

definitions: long thick pillow or cushion placed under other pillows for support
examples: The bolster provided extra back support while reading in bed
Decorative bolsters adorned the living room sofa

definitions: metal pin or bar with head and thread for fastening things together
roll or length of fabric or wallpaper as manufactured unit
sudden flash or discharge of lightning from clouds
examples: He tightened the bolt to secure the machinery parts
The door bolt prevented unwanted entry
She purchased three bolts of silk fabric for the project
A bolt of wallpaper covers approximately thirty square feet
A bolt of lightning struck the tall oak tree
The storm produced several bolts in rapid succession

definitions: explosive device designed to detonate and cause damage or destruction
complete failure especially of theatrical or entertainment production
examples: The bomb squad safely defused the suspicious device
World War Two bombs are still discovered in European cities
The expensive movie was a bomb at the box office
Despite famous actors, the play was a complete bomb

definitions: military aircraft crew member responsible for aiming and releasing bombs
beetle that ejects hot chemical spray as defense mechanism
examples: The bombardier calculated the precise moment to release the payload
World War Two bombardiers underwent extensive training
The bombardier beetle sprayed its attacker with boiling chemicals
Scientists study bombardier beetles for biomimetic applications

definitions: continuous attack with bombs, shells, or other missiles on a target
examples: The city endured heavy bombardment for three consecutive days
Naval bombardment preceded the amphibious landing

definitions: military aircraft designed to drop bombs on ground targets
person who plants or detonates explosive devices
examples: The strategic bomber flew missions deep into enemy territory
Heavy bombers played crucial roles in World War Two
Police arrested the bomber before another attack occurred
The suicide bomber targeted the crowded marketplace

definitions: attack or act of attacking with bombs from aircraft or planted devices
examples: The bombing destroyed several buildings in the industrial district
Precision bombing minimized civilian casualties

definitions: sudden shocking or surprising piece of news or revelation
informal term for very attractive woman especially blonde
examples: The report dropped a bombshell about government corruption
Her resignation announcement was a complete bombshell
The movie featured a blonde bombshell as the lead actress
She was considered a bombshell in 1950s Hollywood

definitions: situation creating sudden increase in wealth, luck, or profits unexpectedly
examples: The tech startup became a bonanza for early investors
Discovery of oil created an economic bonanza for the region

definitions: strong connection or relationship between people or things
certificate issued by government or company promising to repay borrowed money
legally binding agreement or promise especially regarding bail
examples: The mother felt an instant bond with her newborn baby
Years of friendship created an unbreakable bond between them
Government bonds offer steady returns for conservative investors
She invested her savings in municipal bonds
The defendant was released on a fifty thousand dollar bond
He signed a bond guaranteeing completion of the project

definitions: state of being enslaved or having freedom restricted by another
sexual practice involving physical restraint for erotic stimulation
examples: The novel depicted the bondage endured by enslaved people
They fought to free themselves from economic bondage
The adult store sold bondage equipment and accessories
Consensual bondage requires trust between partners

definitions: process of forming close emotional connection or relationship between people
examples: Parent-child bonding begins immediately after birth
Team bonding exercises improved workplace collaboration

definitions: hard whitish tissue making up the skeleton of vertebrate animals
examples: The x-ray revealed a fractured bone in her ankle
Calcium helps maintain strong healthy bones

definitions: informal term for embarrassing mistake or blunder
slang term for erection of the penis
examples: He made a real boner by sending the email to everyone
That boner cost the team the championship game
The teenage boy tried to hide his unexpected boner
Morning boners are a normal physiological response

definitions: large outdoor fire built for warmth, celebration, or burning waste
examples: They gathered around the bonfire to roast marshmallows
The beach bonfire lasted until early morning

definitions: water pipe device used for smoking cannabis or tobacco
deep resonant sound of a large bell or gong
examples: The glass bong sat on the coffee table
He cleaned his bong after each use
The church bell's bong echoed through the valley
Big Ben's bong marks each hour in London

definitions: pair of small drums of different sizes played with hands in Latin music
examples: The musician's fingers danced across the bongo drums
Bongos provide rhythmic foundation in salsa music

definitions: medium-sized predatory fish related to tuna found in warm oceans
examples: The fishermen caught several bonito off the coast
Bonito makes excellent sashimi when properly prepared

definitions: woman's or baby's hat tied under chin with wide brim
British term for hinged cover over automobile engine
examples: The baby wore a white lace bonnet for the christening
Pioneer women wore bonnets for sun protection
He lifted the bonnet to check the engine oil
Steam poured from under the car's bonnet

definitions: endangered great ape species native to Congo closely related to chimpanzees
examples: Bonobos share over ninety-eight percent of human DNA
Female bonobos lead their social groups

definitions: Japanese art of growing ornamental miniature trees in containers through pruning
examples: His prized bonsai tree was over fifty years old
Creating bonsai requires patience and artistic vision

definitions: sound made to show disapproval or contempt especially by audiences
examples: The crowd's boos drowned out the politician's speech
Loud boos erupted when the referee made the call

definitions: large tropical seabird with colorful feet diving for fish
informal term for stupid or foolish person
examples: Blue-footed boobies nest on the Galapagos Islands
The booby plunged into the ocean after fish
Don't be such a booby about obvious scams
The poor booby fell for every trick

definitions: style of blues music with repetitive bass rhythm for dancing
examples: The band played upbeat boogie throughout the night
Boogie music got everyone on the dance floor

definitions: set of printed or written pages bound together containing text
set of financial records or accounts for business transactions
examples: She read the entire book in one sitting
The library's rare book collection includes first editions
The accountant reviewed the company's books for irregularities
All transactions must be entered in the books daily

definitions: person who binds books professionally assembling and covering pages
examples: The bookbinder restored the ancient manuscript with care
Skilled bookbinders use traditional hand-sewing techniques

definitions: craft or process of physically assembling and covering books from sheets
examples: Traditional bookbinding requires specialized tools and materials
She studied bookbinding to preserve family documents

definitions: piece of furniture with shelves for storing and displaying books
examples: The mahogany bookcase held her extensive collection
They assembled the bookcase in the home office

definitions: person who arranges bookings for performers, venues, or services
examples: The band's booker scheduled their entire summer tour
A talented booker can make or break a performer's career

definitions: informal term for bookmaker who accepts and pays off bets
examples: The bookie took bets on all major sporting events
He owed his bookie three thousand dollars

definitions: arrangement to reserve accommodations, tickets, or services in advance
official recording of arrest and charges at police station
examples: She made a booking for dinner at the restaurant
The hotel booking included breakfast and spa access
The suspect's booking took place at midnight
Police completed the booking process within two hours
